intro: Trigonella cylindracea f. jaffensis, commonly known as the Jaffa trigonella, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to dry conditions. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees. The species is noted for its hardy nature and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
